data.title: Jeremy Slate
data.meta_description:
Jeremy Slate. Actor: Der Marshal. Born by the Atlantic Ocean, Jeremy Slate also had a Pacific Ocean view when he lived in Malibu, California. In between oceans he has traveled the world.

He attended a military academy, joined the US Navy at 16 and was barely 18 when his destroyer joined the invasion of Normandy on D-Day (June 6, 1944). Aboard that destroyer at Omaha Beach that day, he vowed if...
data.text:
(1966) Unsold pilot: Starred in a sitcom pilot called "Yankee Stay Here" in which he played an American officer during WW2 who was ordered to lead a motley crew of Italian partisans behind German lines. The teleplay was written by Arne Sultan.

(1968) Unsold pilot: Co-starred in a sitcom pilot for ABC called "The Princess and Me". The pilot starred Barbara Hershey as a European princess traveling the U.S. incognito and Slate played a U.S. State Department official who, unhappily, is assigned to accompany her. The teleplay was written by Bernard Slade and directed by E.W. Swackhamer.
